source.full: Twilight Imperium: Embers of the Imperium

adversary.name: Brother of Yin
description: The Yin Brotherhood is a sect of Human clones affected by a non-lethal form of the Greyfire disease that leaves their skin rough and gray, covered in a thickly layered web of scars. They are often persecuted or discriminated against due to their work in forbidden genetic research, but also because they are a religiously fervent people who aggressively seek converts and sympathizers. Some believe so strongly they are willing to sacrifice themselves for their brethren.

adversary.name: Desperate Citizen
description: Despite the influence of the Great Powers, uncounted trillions of desperate beings fall through the cracks. Independent worlds, colonies, and even the wealthiest home systems have teeming masses of the desperate and hungry crowding spaceports, pleading for help.

abilities.name: Desperate Plea
abilities.description: May make an {@b opposed {@skill Charm||crb} versus {@skill Cool||crb} check} targeting one character within medium range as an action; if successful, the target must spend their next action to ensure that this character is okay.

adversary.name: Hacan Merchant
description: Trade is an exalted aspect of {@archetype Hacan} life, and many {@archetype Hacan} trading clan members live as merchants and chartered ship captains. They transport goods from world to world in everything from ancient tramp freighters to secure, environment-controlled specialty haulers, haggling and negotiating their way to profit along whichever trade route they license from their clan.

abilities.name: One More Thing...
abilities.description: When targeted by a {@skill Negotiation||crb} check, may spend {@symbols hh} to force the other party to include an item worth at least 100 aurei in the deal; this item may be visibly in their possession or something they must acquire to close the deal.

adversary.name: Hylar Engineer
description: The {@rule Universities of Jol-Nar} produce some of the finest engineers in the galaxy, and they know it. Unfortunately, they tend to dismiss the ideas of anyone not trained at the Universities out of hand, responding by first listing the consequences of such a foolhardy action. Despite this, they can be found perched atop a busy swirl of mechanical tentacles at research facilities, universities, labs, shipyards, and other construction sites across the galaxy.

abilities.name: Ionic Discharge
abilities.description: After making a successful melee attack, may spend {@symbols aa} to reduce all damage dealt to 0 and cause one piece of equipment the target is holding to cease functioning for the rest of the encounter.

adversary.name: Sol Colonist
description: Perhaps the most ubiquitous of all the sentient species, {@archetype Human|Humans} seem to colonize every barren rock and frozen wasteland they find. Seeing themselves as rugged individualists, most colonists are wary of outsiders and any centralized government looking to assert any kind of authority over them.

abilities.name: This Ain't Mecatol Rex
abilities.description: Add {@dice setback to social skill checks targeting this minion group for each {@rule the keleres of the council|Keleres}-affiliated character within short range.

adversary.name: Vassal System Governor
description: Many of the Great Civilizations control vassal planets, with populations that have pledged fealty in exchange for protection and the right to manage their own internal affairs. The governors of these systems must walk a fine line to provide the independence their citizens crave without angering the powers that maintain ultimate control for strategic, economic, or political benefits. Those not up to this delicate task quickly find themselves replaced by one side or the other.

abilities.name: Ad Hominem Attack
abilities.description: After making a social skill check, may spend {@symbols aa} or {@symbols t} to recover 4 strain.

abilities.name: Hyperbolic Eloquence
abilities.description: Once per encounter, may make an {@difficulty Average|Deception} targeting one character as an action; if successful, target adds {@symbols fh} to the results of their next social skill check; may spend {@symbols aa} to affect an additional target or {@symbols t} to cause all targets to add {@symbols ff} instead of {@symbols f}.

gear: {@gear dignitary's garb|Ambassadorial clothing} with magen personal deflector unit: 3 defense.

adversary.name: Veiled Brood Agent
description: The Veiled Brood control the {@rule Sardakk N'orr} government from behind the scenes, employing their own agents in secret to manipulate the political forces that shape their society and those around them. Veiled Brood agents look indistinguishable from most {@archetype N'orr} but are highly adept at close-quarters fighting and social manipulation.

abilities.name: Master Manipulator
abilities.description: If the Veiled Brood agent knows a character's Desire or Fear Motivation, they downgrade the difficulty of all {@skill Deception||crb} and {@skill Leadership||crb} checks targeting the character twice.

adversary.name: Winnaran Custodian Scholar
description: Those {@archetype Winnu} descended from the survivors of the orbital bombardment of {@rule Mecatol Rex} remain in the galactic capital, preserving what knowledge of their forebears and the Lazax Empire they can and maintaining Mecatol City for some hoped-for future Emperor. Scholars among the {@rule winnu|Winnaran Custodians} spend much of their time researching the Imperium-that-was, but in this age they also find themselves working with unsavory types to recover lost knowledge, and even having to defend against kidnapping by forces that hope to exploit their knowledge. For this reason, many Winnaran scholars seek out the {@rule the keleres of the council|Keleres} for protection and aid.

abilities.name: Scholarly Guidance
abilities.description: Once per encounter, may spend an action to reduce the difficulty of another character's next non-combat check by 2.

gear: Cloak: adds {@dice setback} to {@skill Perception||crb} or {@skill Vigilance||crb} checks made to notice this character
{@gear Savant} with archives of semicorrupted Lazax data.

adversary.name: Xxcha Elder
description: The testudinal {@archetype Xxcha} hold great reverence for their elders, deferring most leadership duties to their oldest qualified member present. This gerontocracy means that the greater the leadership position, the older the {@archetype Xxcha} holding it is likely to be. Unlike in some cultures, the {@archetype Xxcha} seem to have limitless patience indulging the eccentricities some of their elders pick up over long lives of experience, though this can prove highly frustrating for any non-{@archetype Xxcha} present.

abilities.name: Building to a Point
abilities.description: May spend {@symbols aaa} to add {@symbols t} to the results of the Xxcha Elder's next social check during this encounter.

adversary.name: Arborec Letani Behemoth
description: The Letani are among the largest organic sentient beings yet discovered in the galaxy, although whether they can be considered independent beings, since they are part of the {@rule Arborec} organism, is a matter of some debate among biologists. The Letani serve as nodes that allow the {@rule Arborec} hivemind to operate off-world, collecting experiences to eventually bring home to Nestphar. They also coordinate {@rule Arborec} forces in battle, often appearing as thick stalks with mushroom-cap frills surrounding a circular maw, reaching out with a half-dozen vine-tentacles.

abilities.name: Fling Aside
abilities.description: As a maneuver, may make an {@b opposed {@skill Coordination||crb} versus {@skill Coordination||crb} check} targeting one engaged silhouette 1 or 0 character; if successful, fling the target up to long range in a direction of the Letani behemoth's choosing; on the target's next turn, it suffers the effects of falling from short range [see page 112 of the Genesys Core Rulebook].

abilities.name: Symphonic Node
abilities.description: May suffer 2 strain to add {@symbols sa} to the results of all checks made by {@rule Arborec} within extreme range until the Letani Behemoth's next turn.

weapons.name: Gaping maw
weapons.details: While immobilized by this weapon's {@quality Ensnare||crb} item quality, target is exposed to a {@rule Fire, Acid, and Corrosive Atmospheres|corrosive atmosphere|crb} with a rating of 6.

adversary.name: Creuss Riftwalker
description: While most {@rule ghosts of creuss|Creuss} stay within the {@rule Creuss: Beyond the Gate|Shaleri passage}, a rift to another reality, some {@rule ghosts of creuss|Creuss} have been known to travel far away from their home and explore the galaxy. While often peaceful, they possess terrifyingly effective weapons and have been known to use them when violence seems to suit their own inscrutable ends. It is possible these "riftwalkers" may even be working on behalf of their people as part of some bid for galactic supremacy.

abilities.name: Infuriating Enigma
abilities.description: Characters making a social skill check targeting the Creuss riftwalker suffer 2 strain per {@symbols h}.

abilities.name: Wormhole Walker
abilities.description: May spend one Story Point to teleport anywhere within extreme range as a maneuver.

gear: {@gear Sealed Environment Suit}: +2 soak, +2 wound threshold

adversary.name: Arctic Sharak
description: Native to the frozen lodinium mines of Bereg, the arctic sharak is always looking for a warm spot in which to nest and hibernate. These large, tusked quadrupeds have a thick blubber layer to help them stay warm, and they are very good at digging their way into mining tunnels or sneaking onto warm ships left unattended. If disturbed or surprised, they tend to attack.

abilities.name: Burrower
abilities.description: May move through solid ground as if it were difficult terrain, leaving a tunnel behind it.

adversary.name: Daartar Hound
description: Pack-hunting predators from the {@rule Barony of Letnev|Barony} vassal world of {@rule Arc Prime and Wren Terra|Wren Terra}, the lithe, short-furred Daartar hounds have an excellent sense of smell and hearing. Their talents have made them popular working animals, especially among the {@archetype Letnev}. These hounds serve as trackers and contraband sniffers, and they even fight alongside law enforcement officers. Some trainers make a tidy profit selling them off-world.

abilities.name: Scent Tracking
abilities.description: Add {@symbols ss} to the results of {@skill Perception||crb}, {@skill Survival||crb}, or {@skill Vigilance||crb} checks the Daartar hound makes to track or spot a character or to {@rule determine Initiative||crb}.

adversary.name: Durzuga Envoy
description: Hybrid beings resulting from Arzuga fungal spores cultivated within a corpse, the Dirzuga are critical to {@rule Arborec} communication and trade with the outside world. Acting as envoys and diplomats, the Dirzuga offer a variety of biotech products, predominantly medicines unique to the {@rule Arborec}, in exchange for things that range from standard to the somewhat odd—such as modifications to pollution regulations or planting rights to seemingly worthless pieces of land.

abilities.name: Regenerative Balm
abilities.description: As an action, may apply a balm to one engaged character, allowing the target to make an {@difficulty Average|Resilience} check as an out-of-turn incidental; for each {@symbols s}, the target heals one Critical Injury; if successful, the target also heals 2 wounds at the start of each of their turns for the remainder of the encounter.

adversary.name: Elder Titan

abilities.name: Swat
abilities.description: After making a successful combat check with its fists against a target of silhouette 2 or smaller, may spend {@symbols aaa} or {@symbols t} to fling the target up to medium range in a direction of the elder Titan's choosing; on the target's next turn, it suffers the effects of falling from short range [see page 112 of the {@title Genesys} Core Rulebook]).

weapons.name: Grav-field fists
weapons.details: When used to attack a target with a smaller silhouette, the {@quality Knockdown||crb} quality triggers without spending {@symbols a}.

description: Long ago, the {@rule Mahact Gene-Sorcerers|Mahact} created these advanced, humanoid AI constructs as an immortal labor force to prepare planets and create specialized facilities and weapons. Now emancipated from the control of the gene-sorcerers, these building-sized intelligences cultivate macrogardens on {@rule Elysium}. Odd but generally benevolent beings, the {@rule Titans of Ul|Titans} often hire themselves out as construction workers or recreate useful {@rule Mahact Gene-Sorcerers|Mahact} technology. In exchange, they usually request unique flora or fauna for their gardens.

adversary.name: Empyrean Observer
description: Enigmatic recorders of galactic history, the {@rule Empyrean} are winged humanoids with faceless heads. They communicate via electromagnetic waves, but they almost never initiate any sort of contact with individuals or civilizations, preferring instead to observe. Although they are largely ignored by most beings, some of the clever and desperate have found them open to trading information. If attacked, they flood the entire electromagnetic spectrum with noise, disabling anyone nearby while they depart.

abilities.name: EM Flood
abilities.description: May make a {@difficulty Hard|Discipline} as an action; if successful, all characters with a communications device within long range suffer 2 strain per {@symbols s}; may spend {@symbols aa} or {@symbols t} to {@rule staggered|stagger|crb} one affected character for one round.

abilities.name: Radiowave Communications
abilities.description: Can emit radio waves to communicate via any device capable of detecting them.

abilities.name: Spaceworthy
abilities.description: Can survive in the vacuum of space without a space suit.

weapons.name: Concealed molecular destabilizer
weapons.details: If this weapon inflicts a Critical Injury, instead of rolling the result normally, roll 1d10: on a 1-5 the target suffers the Crippled result, on a 6-7 the target suffers the Maimed result, on a 8-10, the target suffers the Blinded result.

adversary.name: Garach
description: These large, long-bodied reptilian hunters with eight legs have spread and adapted to become apex predators along the shores and wetlands of several planets (thanks to a number of ill-considered plans to use them as pest control on colony worlds). They spin underwater webs that spread like fishing nets and wait for a meal to pass through. Once they detect a potential meal, they begin rolling, cinching their web shut and dragging their prey into deeper water to feed.

abilities.name: Webbing
abilities.description: May spend {@symbols hh} or {@symbols d} to cause a target making a check within medium range to become {@rule immobilized||crb} until the end of the encounter; may spend a maneuver to move an {@rule immobilized||crb} target one range band closer to this character; targets may escape webbing with a successful {@difficulty Hard|Coordination} as an action.

adversary.name: Gashlai Fire Warden
description: The Fire Wardens are leaders among their people, each elected to complete a specific task by their community and sworn to serve until that task is done. Like all {@archetype Gashlai}, the Fire Wardens wear suits of dense metal to contain their burning spirit when away from their fiery homeworld. Those Fire Wardens whose tasks involve warfare wield melt-edges, blades that almost burn hot enough to ignite the very air.

abilities.name: You Can All Burn
abilities.description: Once per encounter, may suffer 3 wounds as an action to force all characters within short range to make a {@difficulty Hard|Coordination} as an out-of-turn incidental; they suffer 8 wounds if they fail, and they suffer one Critical Injury per {@symbols hhh} or {@symbols d}.

gear: {@gear Sealed environmental suit|Ember suit}: +2 soak, +2 wound threshold

adversary.name: Naalu Exploiter
description: While all {@archetype Druaa} have telepathic powers, some focus on their ability to interfere with the minds of others rather than on passively reading their thoughts. Many of these individuals are employed by the {@rule Naalu Collective} to further Naalu interests in the greater galaxy. But a few choose to abandon the {@rule Naalu Collective|Collective's} purpose and use their abilities for their own ends. Both types are incredibly dangerous, but the latter are the ones whom the {@rule Naalu Collective|Collective} go to any lengths to hunt down and eliminate.

abilities.name: Exploit Animosity
abilities.description: Once per round, may spend a Story Point before another character performs a combat check or social skill check; the character must select a target of the Naalu exploiter's choice for their check or suffer 5 strain.

abilities.name: Influencer
abilities.description: Once per encounter as an action, may make an {@b opposed {@skill Discipline||crb} versus {@skill Discipline||crb} check} targeting a character within medium range; if successful, the target must reveal their Fear, Flaw, or Desire publicly (GM's choice) and suffers 1 strain per {@symbols a}.

adversary.name: Pituis
description: Pituis are dangerous and regrettably commonplace vermin found on heavily industrialized worlds throughout the galaxy, originally created by the {@rule Mahact Gene-Sorcerers|Mahact} as a form of waste-disposal. These bloblike masses consume a number of industrial chemical biproducts for food, but they reproduce asexually, can squeeze through almost any opening, and secrete powerful acids on their pseudopods. Worse, certain biochemical compounds in their oozing bodies, if absorbed into the body, can cause massive cerebral hemorrhages in most creatures.

abilities.name: Biochemical Toxin
abilities.description: When a character makes a check while engaged with a pituis, may spend {@symbols hhh} or {@symbols d} to cause the character to suffer the Bleeding Out Critical Injury.

weapons.name: Acidic pseudopods
weapons.details: If this weapon inflicts a Critical Injury, instead of rolling the result normally, inflict the Bleeding Out Critical Injury.

adversary.name: Wake Worm
description: The mere mention of wake worms is enough to make most captains restart their preflight checklist from scratch. The bane of trade hubs across the galaxy, these space-black worms are between six and ten meters long and consume stellar fast ions to create microbursts of plasma propulsion. This would be fine, except most starship engines emit a radiation the worms find irresistible. If they wriggle into engine housings, they can wreak absolute havoc when a ship crosses the lightspeed barrier.

abilities.name: Engine Trouble
abilities.description: While within short range of a starship, may make an {@difficulty Average|Coordination} as an action; if successful, the worm (or minion group) attaches to the engine housing and inflicts a Critical Hit on the starship, adding +10 per {@symbols a} to the result.

adversary.name: Young Titan
description: Younger Titans are smaller versions of their elders, a mere three or four meters tall. They have a curious nature that borders on naïve and tend to enjoy traveling the galaxy and learning about the natural world. Most are friendly and eagerly socialize with all manner of beings. Eventually, their travels become punctuated with returns to {@rule Elysium}, until, as they reach adulthood, their stays there begin to outlast their periods of travel.

abilities.name: Expert Instruction
abilities.description: When performing the assist maneuver, may upgrade the ability of the check once instead of adding {@dice boost}.

adversary.name: Crime Boss
description: While skilled at arranging criminal activity for profit, leaders of gangs and organized criminal syndicates find they have to rule through fear. Often, they instill fear through detached, dissociative monologues alongside an unpredictable combination of screaming rage and cold-blooded, calculated murder. The most powerful crime bosses can control syndicates whose influence spans entire colonies, and some even have multisystem criminal enterprises.

abilities.name: Charismatic Menace
abilities.description: Allies within short range add {@symbols a} to checks they make; opponents within short range add {@symbols h} to checks they make.

abilities.name: Send a Message
abilities.description: When this character incapacitates an enemy, may suffer 2 strain to force all opponents within medium range to make a {@difficulty Hard|fear} (see page 243 of the {@title Genesys} Core Rulebook).

adversary.name: Hacan Sell-Spear
description: Sell-spears are blooded warriors, often veteran close-quarters specialists who once fought for the Quieron but have now chosen to sell their services to the highest bidder. Adept at desert warfare, sell-spears wield the traditional Hacan dune spear, an ornate gyro-spear that also functions as a rifle. Sell-spears are sought after by merchant traders across the galaxy looking for reliable guardians.

abilities.name: Momentum
abilities.description: If the sell-spear performed a move maneuver, they add +3 to the damage of one hit of any successful {@skill Brawl||crb} or {@skill Melee||crb} checks they make during the same turn.

gear: Desert combat armor: +1 soak, adds {@dice boost} to {@skill Resilience||crb} and {@skill Survival||crb} checks in desert climates

adversary.name: Hylar Data Snoop
description: Governments, corporations, criminal enterprises, and even ancient {@rule Mahact Gene-Sorcerers|Mahact} devices have secrets stored in extensive data management systems. Some amoral {@archetype Hylar}, particularly those working for the {@rule Mentak Coalition}, {@rule the Nomad}, or the {@rule Universities of Jol-Nar}, specialize in infiltrating these systems and digging out valuable secrets to sell to the highest bidder. Although every culture has its own computer systems experts, widely held stereotypes ensure the {@archetype Hylar} are always sought after.

abilities.name: Compromise Security
abilities.description: Once per encounter, may make a {@difficulty Hard|Computers} to take control of a security system (such as a sealed door, alarm system, or automated weapon) as an action for the remainder of the encounter, and may spend {@symbols t} to immediately use this system as an incidental.

gear: {@gear Sealed environmental suit}: +2 soak, +2 wound threshold

adversary.name: Master Forger
description: The master forger is a fixture of the criminal underworld— part artist, part criminal, and all untrustworthy. They provide fake tickets to events; replica artworks for fraud scams; and false idents for criminals, spies, smugglers, customs jumpers, and more, enabling travel past security checkpoints. If there is a person or a sensor that has to be tricked in order to accept a thing as authentic, the forger can fool it.

abilities.name: Forged Documents
abilities.description: Once per encounter, may produce forged documents as a maneuver to add {@symbols ss} to the results of any {@skill Deception||crb} check.

gear: Very realistic looking credentials from four different Great Civilizations

adversary.name: Nomad Destabilizer
description: The mysterious {@rule the nomad|Nomad} employs an unknown number of agents, many of whom were once heroes among their people. Most of the time, no one even realizes the agent is working for {@rule the Nomad}, because their goals are so opaque and would seem to rely on impossibly long odds. Yet no matter how random the string of occurrences, in instances when a known agent is linked to events, the outcome seems to benefit {@rule the Nomad}.

abilities.name: Butterfly Effect
abilities.description: May spend {@symbols hh} from an opponent's check and suffer 2 strain to add {@symbols d} to the results of the next check made by an opponent.

adversary.name: Pirate Raider
description: Although piracy is impossible when a ship is traveling at superluminal velocities, all ships must slow down before approaching a gravity well (such as a planet). At this point, pirates can strike an unwary vessel. Pirates come from nearly every species and culture, though they all tend to share a certain ruthless desperation.

abilities.name: Pirate Loyalty
abilities.description: If this group has two or more minions, and they generate {@symbols hh} or {@symbols d} during a check, the minion group splits into two minion groups, roughly in half (generating a new NPC Initiative slot if needed).

adversary.name: Saar Scrapper
description: The {@rule Clan of Saar|Saar} have picked over ancient battlefields, accident sites, and junk orbits for as long as most can remember. They have a nose for the best salvage and can strip a courier to parts before its engine cools, but thankfully most stick to legal salvage claims and clearly mark their territory. They're as good at repairs as they are at disassembly, so smart Keleres try to stay on their good side.

abilities.name: Many Hands Make Light the Load
abilities.description: While providing assistance on a {@skill Mechanics||crb} check to repair a vehicle, increase the hull trauma or system strain repaired by 2; if the check is to repair a Critical Hit, reduce the difficulty of the check by 1, to a minimum of {@difficulty Easy}; this is in addition to the other benefits of assistance.

adversary.name: Shadow Assassin
description: Many factions—whether the Great Civilizations, criminal syndicates, or the ultrawealthy—employ stealthy assassins to carry out their dirty work. Many assassins have undergone intense training with a military special forces unit; others are gifted with natural abilities, such as the {@archetype Yssaril}. They are flexible, equally able to kill from far away with rifles and up close with a blade, and they leave few clues of their presence.

abilities.name: Into Shadow
abilities.description: After making any check, may spend {@symbols aa} or {@symbols t} to hide in shadows or cover within short range as a maneuver; shadow assassin does not reveal themself until they make a combat check (or perform another action that would reasonably cause them to be spotted), but they can be revealed if another character spends an action to make a successful {@b opposed {@skill Perception||crb} or {@skill Vigilance||crb} versus {@skill Stealth||crb} check}.

weapons.name: Scoped long-range grazer rifle
weapons.details: Reduce difficulty of combat checks at long or extreme range by 1.

gear: {@gear Covert armored skin}: 2 defense, adds {@symbols ss} to results of {@skill Stealth||crb} checks the assassin makes, adds {@dice setback|2} to any {@skill Perception||crb} or {@skill Vigilance||crb} checks other characters make to find or notice the assassin.

adversary.name: Smuggler
description: Smugglers might say they are a necessary, unappreciated part of the galactic economy. At their very best, smugglers break blockades and battle lines to deliver food and medical supplies to refugees and regions in need. At their worst, they move blackmarket weapons, narcotics, and even enslaved laborers. No matter the cargo or security, if the price is right, there is a desperate smuggler willing to make the run. Some smugglers run as part of a crew, but others prefer to work alone.
gear: Heavy garach leather jacket and reinforced pants: +1 soak

adversary.name: Yssaril Spy
description: Over the centuries, the {@rule Yssaril Tribes|Yssaril} have built an entire civilization and economy centering on their natural talent for spycraft. Thanks in no small part to their naturally evolved chameleonic ability, their spies already have an advantage over those of the other Great Civilizations, and the {@rule Yssaril Tribes} are sure to enhance their agents with all sorts of high-tech equipment and weapons.

abilities.name: Chameleonic
abilities.description: May spend a Story Point to add {@symbols ss} to the results of any {@skill Stealth||crb} check this character makes or to add {@symbols ff} to the results of a {@skill Vigilance||crb} or {@skill Perception||crb} check another character makes to detect this character.

gear: Comms jammer: when activated, communication devices may not send or receive messages for five minutes

adversary.name: Combat Pilot
description: Standing militaries field a suite of combat vehicles, including starfighters, bombers, gunships, landing craft, tanks, troop transports, and more. Most combat pilots who operate them hold an officer's rank, particularly when it comes to more powerful or expensive vehicles. This profile also works for a gunner or crew member on a warship.

adversary.name: Combat Pilot (Argent Flight)
description: Standing militaries field a suite of combat vehicles, including starfighters, bombers, gunships, landing craft, tanks, troop transports, and more. Most combat pilots who operate them hold an officer's rank, particularly when it comes to more powerful or expensive vehicles. This profile also works for a gunner or crew member on a warship.

The Shikrai Kun Akaruk lead the Shikrai Kun Akarun, including disciplined airborne soldiers and instinctive pilots in Shrike interceptors and Aerie Sentinel mechs. Units frequently rotate command to increase unit cohesion, and they favor quick hitand-fade attacks.
{@b Combat Pilot:} Gain the {@talent knack for it|Knack for It (Piloting)|crb} talent.

adversary.name: Combat Pilot (Barony of Letnev)
description: Standing militaries field a suite of combat vehicles, including starfighters, bombers, gunships, landing craft, tanks, troop transports, and more. Most combat pilots who operate them hold an officer's rank, particularly when it comes to more powerful or expensive vehicles. This profile also works for a gunner or crew member on a warship.

Letnev officers tend to be ruthlessly ambitious, as in the {@rule Barony of Letnev|Barony} higher ranks in the military come with greater wealth and social status. They lead the Letnev fusiliers as well as the aristocratic Toumarin pilots of the Dunlain Reapers and Ashbringer escort fighters, and their burning ambition often drives them to lead from the front.
{@b Combat Pilot:} Gain the Superior Firepower ability (add {@dice boost|2} to all {@skill Gunnery||crb} checks made by this character). Increase combat rating to 3.

abilities.name: Superior Firepower
abilities.description: Add {@dice boost|2} to all {@skill Gunnery||crb} checks made by this character.

adversary.name: Combat Pilot (Clan of Saar)
description: Standing militaries field a suite of combat vehicles, including starfighters, bombers, gunships, landing craft, tanks, troop transports, and more. Most combat pilots who operate them hold an officer's rank, particularly when it comes to more powerful or expensive vehicles. This profile also works for a gunner or crew member on a warship.
Saar war packs and scrapper crews, no matter if they fly the Rho escort fighters, a Scavenger Zeta mech, or a scrap freighter, all look to a ship captain or clan elder to direct them.
{@b Combat Pilot:} Gain the {@talent skilled mechanic|Skilled Mechanic 2} talent.

adversary.name: Combat Pilot (Embers of Muaat)
description: Standing militaries field a suite of combat vehicles, including starfighters, bombers, gunships, landing craft, tanks, troop transports, and more. Most combat pilots who operate them hold an officer's rank, particularly when it comes to more powerful or expensive vehicles. This profile also works for a gunner or crew member on a warship.

Appointed by the Fire Wardens, stewards lead small units known as {@i flares} into battle. These might be tough, armored infantry or the specialized novash pilots who control vehicles like the Colossus or Supernova bomber.

adversary.name: Field Commander (Yssaril Tribes)
description: Rank-and-file troops require leadership in the field, whether from a grizzled sergeant or from a fresh-faced junior officer. This profile represents a character who might lead an entire platoon, a squad, or even just an elite fire team into battle. It can also represent a tank commander, starship bridge officer, or fighter squadron leader if it replaces the {@gear beam rifle} with a {@gear beam pistol}.

The Guild of Spies uses field agents to direct its hit squads and control its undercover assets, often relying on stealth craft to access targets and assets in secret. The Yssaril hit squads use their unique fading ability to launch lethal stealth ambushes against helpless opponents. In full-scale war, these hit squads are grouped into larger field formations, meaning that fighting a Yssaril army is like trying to shoot the fog.
Gain +1 {@characteristic Cunning||crb}; gain two ranks in {@skill Stealth||crb}; gain Silhouette 0.

abilities.name: Tactical Direction
abilities.description: May spend a maneuver to direct one friendly minion group within medium range; that group may immediately perform a maneuver as an out-of-turn incidental or add {@dice boost} to the next check it makes.

adversary.name: Infantry Soldier
description: Each of the great powers in the galaxy has its own standing army of soldiers, each with unique equipment and training. The equipment can be modified using the optional rules from {@table 2-1: Cultural Manufacturing Differences} on page 106.

items: {@adversary Infantry Soldier (Argent Flight)|Argent Flight Infantry Soldier}
{@adversary Infantry Soldier (Barony of Letnev)|Barony of Letnev Infantry Soldier}

{@adversary Infantry Soldier (Embers of Muaat)|Embers of Muaat Infantry Soldier}

adversary.name: Infantry Soldier (Argent Flight)
description: Each of the great powers in the galaxy has its own standing army of soldiers, each with unique equipment and training. The equipment can be modified using the optional rules from {@table 2-1: Cultural Manufacturing Differences} on page 106.

The Shikrai Kun Akaruk lead the Shikrai Kun Akarun, including disciplined airborne soldiers and instinctive pilots in Shrike interceptors and Aerie Sentinel mechs. Units frequently rotate command to increase unit cohesion, and they favor quick hitand-fade attacks.

Increase {@characteristic Agility||crb} by 1; gain the Flyer ability (can fly via wingpack; see the {@sidebar Flying||crb} sidebar on page 100 of the {@title Genesys} Core Rulebook); replace beam rifle with Shikrai needle bow (Ranged [Heavy]; Damage 1; Critical 1; Range [Medium]; Limited Ammo 1, Pierce 6, Unwieldy 3) and 10 arrows.

abilities.name: Wingpack Flyer
abilities.description: Can fly via wingpack; see the {@sidebar Flying||crb} sidebar on page 100 of the {@title Genesys} Core Rulebook.

adversary.name: Infantry Soldier (Barony of Letnev)
description: Each of the great powers in the galaxy has its own standing army of soldiers, each with unique equipment and training. The equipment can be modified using the optional rules from {@table 2-1: Cultural Manufacturing Differences} on page 106.

Letnev officers tend to be ruthlessly ambitious, as in the Barony higher ranks in the military come with greater wealth and social status. They lead the Letnev fusiliers as well as the aristocratic Toumarin pilots of the Dunlain Reapers and Ashbringer escort fighters, and their burning ambition often drives them to lead from the front.
No change.

adversary.name: Infantry Soldier (Clan of Saar)
description: Each of the great powers in the galaxy has its own standing army of soldiers, each with unique equipment and training. The equipment can be modified using the optional rules from {@table 2-1: Cultural Manufacturing Differences} on page 106.
Saar war packs and scrapper crews, no matter if they fly the Rho escort fighters, a Scavenger Zeta mech, or a scrap freighter, all look to a ship captain or clan elder to direct them.
Replace beam rifle with a shot rifle (Ranged [Heavy]; Damage 7; Critical 4; Range [Medium]; Auto-fire).

adversary.name: Infantry Soldier (Embers of Muaat)
description: Each of the great powers in the galaxy has its own standing army of soldiers, each with unique equipment and training. The equipment can be modified using the optional rules from {@table 2-1: Cultural Manufacturing Differences} on page 106.

Appointed by the Fire Wardens, stewards lead small units known as {@i flares} into battle. These might be tough, armored infantry or the specialized novash pilots who control vehicles like the Colossus or Supernova bomber.
Replace beam rifle with a plasma rifle (Ranged [Heavy]; Damage 10; Critical 2; Range [Medium]; Burn 1). Replace combat infantry armor with Ember suit (+2 soak, +1 Brawn). Increase combat rating to 4.
gear: {@gear Sealed environmental suit|Ember suit}: +2 soak, +1 Brawn

adversary.name: Infantry Soldier (Emirates of Hacan)
description: Each of the great powers in the galaxy has its own standing army of soldiers, each with unique equipment and training. The equipment can be modified using the optional rules from {@table 2-1: Cultural Manufacturing Differences} on page 106.

Each emir maintains their own army, but when the Emirates goes to war, they must second a portion of that army to the Quieron's service. The Quieron also maintains a standing force in the form of the Sword Fleet and its integrated marines. When the Emirates' armies are called up, squad leaders from the Sword Marines are distributed among the levies to season them into proper soldiers. Most of the Emirates' heavy equipment such as Pride mechs and Scarhawk fighter craft are also operated by marine pilots.
Gain the {@talent Swift||crb} talent.

adversary.name: Infantry Soldier (Federation of Sol)
description: Each of the great powers in the galaxy has its own standing army of soldiers, each with unique equipment and training. The equipment can be modified using the optional rules from {@table 2-1: Cultural Manufacturing Differences} on page 106.

The Sol Federation fields an experienced officer corps whose members foster an unyielding will to win any fight, no matter how hopeless or how extreme the environment. The rank-andfile Sol troopers are not as fearsome as the Federation's infamous Spec Ops forces, but they are dedicated and drilled to operate as a cohesive unit. If they run into problems they can't handle, they call down heavy support in the form of ZS Thunderbolt mechs, GA Hailstorm artillery tanks, and F5 Hurricane escort fighters.
Increase {@characteristics Willpower} by 1.

adversary.name: Infantry Soldier (Mentak Coalition)
description: Each of the great powers in the galaxy has its own standing army of soldiers, each with unique equipment and training. The equipment can be modified using the optional rules from {@table 2-1: Cultural Manufacturing Differences} on page 106.

The captains of the Mentak Coalition and their crews tend to have a distinctly piratical bent, though they maintain standards of discipline similar to those of the militaries of the other Great Civilizations. They do tend to be equipped for close-quarters fighting and boarding actions.
Replace beam rifle with blazer rifle (Ranged [Heavy]; Damage 8; Critical 3; Range [Medium]; Inaccurate 1, Vicious 2).

adversary.name: Infantry Soldier (Naalu Collective)
description: Each of the great powers in the galaxy has its own standing army of soldiers, each with unique equipment and training. The equipment can be modified using the optional rules from {@table 2-1: Cultural Manufacturing Differences} on page 106.

Wearing crystalline psy-enhancers, seer-sergeants lead the Naalu Collective's forces of Druaa and enslaved vassals like the Miashan into battle. They use their eerie insight to strangle enemy strategies in their infancy, a skill also practiced by the gifted pilots of the Collective's starfighter corps.
Increase {@characteristic Willpower||crb} by 1; gain the {@talent Quick Strike|Quick Strike 1|crb} talent.

adversary.name: Infantry Soldier (Naaz-Rokha Alliance)
description: Each of the great powers in the galaxy has its own standing army of soldiers, each with unique equipment and training. The equipment can be modified using the optional rules from {@table 2-1: Cultural Manufacturing Differences} on page 106.

The Naaz-Rokha are natural cooperators, and their recent energy technology breakthroughs power advanced vehicles like the multimission-capable Eidolon mech. The Alliance has a small but robust standing military, portions of which are sent out into the galaxy in the form of Alliance Expeditionary Forces to explore new regions, perform peacekeeping operations, or deal with potential threats. This approach suits the adventurous and curious Naaz and Rokha just fine.

Increase {@characteristic Intellect||crb} by 1; increase {@characteristic Cunning||crb} by 1; increase wound threshold by 2; gain the Symbiotic Coordination ability (may always perform one additional free maneuver without suffering strain).

abilities.name: Symbiotic Coordination
abilities.description: May always perform one additional free maneuver without suffering strain.

adversary.name: Infantry Soldier (Sardakk N'orr)
description: Each of the great powers in the galaxy has its own standing army of soldiers, each with unique equipment and training. The equipment can be modified using the optional rules from {@table 2-1: Cultural Manufacturing Differences} on page 106.

The centurions command the Tekklar Elite, an implacable force of strong-willed soldiers who endure some of the most extreme combat training in the galaxy. Swarm pilots—most of whom were born with wings—support the fleet and ground troops with Kess'or Fury escort fighters and Valkyrie mechs.

Increase {@characteristic Brawn||crb} by 1; decrease {@characteristic Willpower||crb} by 1; gain {@skill Melee||crb} as a skill; gain a N'orr tarsus glaive (Melee; Damage 7; Critical 3; Range [Short]; Cumbersome 3, Vicious 3); gain the Fighting Horde ability (when this character attacks an opponent engaged with an ally, remove {@dice setback|2} from the pool). Increase combat rating to 4.

abilities.name: Fighting Horde
abilities.description: When this character attacks an opponent engaged with an ally, remove {@dice setback|2} from the pool.

adversary.name: Infantry Soldier (Universities of Jol-Nar)
description: Each of the great powers in the galaxy has its own standing army of soldiers, each with unique equipment and training. The equipment can be modified using the optional rules from {@table 2-1: Cultural Manufacturing Differences} on page 106.

The Proctors lead the Hylar military forces, well aware of the scientific principles and stress tolerances of the equipment carried by each soldier under their command. The Hylar have some of the most advanced technology in the galaxy, which they use to buttress their soldiers' rather pedestrian fighting skills.

Reduce {@characteristic Agility||crb} by 1; increase wound threshold by 2; gain the Computer-Assisted Targeting ability (after using the aim maneuver and making a ranged attack, add {@symbols s} to the results instead of adding {@dice boost} to the pool).

abilities.name: Computer-Assisted Targeting
abilities.description: After using the aim maneuver and making a ranged attack, add {@symbols s} to the results instead of adding {@dice boost} to the pool.

adversary.name: Infantry Soldier (Winnu)
description: Each of the great powers in the galaxy has its own standing army of soldiers, each with unique equipment and training. The equipment can be modified using the optional rules from {@table 2-1: Cultural Manufacturing Differences} on page 106.

The legates of Winnu's Annexus Guard believe Mecatol Rex is theirs by right, and they have been working their forces into a righteous fervor to take it back. The legates oversee entire armies, determining battlefield strategy while leaving small unit tactics to their primuls, who each command a centurios of one hundred well-drilled soldiers. It falls on the primuls to make sure each soldier knows the price of failure for their emperor and themselves.

Gain the Fear of Failure ability (when an allied character or allied vehicle within medium range is incapacitated or destroyed, this character suffers 1 strain and adds {@dice boost} to checks they make until the end of the next round).

abilities.name: Fear of Failure
abilities.description: When an allied character or allied vehicle within medium range is incapacitated or destroyed, this character suffers 1 strain and adds {@dice boost} to checks they make until the end of the next round.

adversary.name: Infantry Soldier (Xxcha Kingdom)
description: Each of the great powers in the galaxy has its own standing army of soldiers, each with unique equipment and training. The equipment can be modified using the optional rules from {@table 2-1: Cultural Manufacturing Differences} on page 106.

The king divides his army into thirty-eight shields, or sccuts, led by the combat veterans known as cchun. The cchun train soldiers, Xxlun fighter pilots, and Indomitus mech drivers to manage their emotions and to remember the peace the king has to forge after a war is won. They always take prisoners.
Increase {@characteristic Brawn||crb} by 1; increase soak by 1. Increase combat rating to 4.

adversary.name: Infantry Soldier (Yin Brotherhood)
description: Each of the great powers in the galaxy has its own standing army of soldiers, each with unique equipment and training. The equipment can be modified using the optional rules from {@table 2-1: Cultural Manufacturing Differences} on page 106.

The Brotherhood isn't possessed of the most skilled warriors, but these warriors make up for it with absolute commitment. Their tactics favor headlong assaults, close-in artillery and airstrikes, and other practices that most consider extremist. Even more concerning is that many of the brothers are willing—some would say eager—to sacrifice themselves in spectacular fashion for their cause.
No change.

adversary.name: Infantry Soldier (Yssaril Tribes)
description: Each of the great powers in the galaxy has its own standing army of soldiers, each with unique equipment and training. The equipment can be modified using the optional rules from {@table 2-1: Cultural Manufacturing Differences} on page 106.

The Guild of Spies uses field agents to direct its hit squads and control its undercover assets, often relying on stealth craft to access targets and assets in secret. The Yssaril hit squads use their unique fading ability to launch lethal stealth ambushes against helpless opponents. In full-scale war, these hit squads are grouped into larger field formations, meaning that fighting a Yssaril army is like trying to shoot the fog.
Gain +1 {@characteristic Cunning||crb}; gain two ranks in {@skill Stealth||crb}; gain Silhouette 0.

adversary.name: Argent Flight Ace
description: The Shikrai produce the most talented natural pilots in the galaxy, and then they train them to be even better. Their aces, like Trrakan Aun Zulok, are living legends among their people, and well-studied threats among rival military forces. In battle, Shikrai aces dare the enemy to keep up, causing nearly as many to wreck their ships giving chase as the Shikrai take out with their cannons.

abilities.name: Avian Agility
abilities.description: Once per session after making a skill check that uses this character's {@characteristic Agility||crb}, may spend a Story Point to add {@symbols ssaa} to the results.

gear: {@vehicle interceptor starfighter (Argent Flight Shrike)|Shrike interceptor starfighter}

adversary.name: Naalu Starfighter Shiressis
description: Based on simulator data gathered during limited joint training exercises, the {@rule Naalu Collective|Naalu's} best Druaa pilots are among the Keleres' worst. However, in real combat engagements, they outperform everyone in almost every way. Thanks to their telepathic abilities, Druaa Shiressis can make themselves almost impossible to hit, juking out of the way an instant before an enemy pilot fires.

abilities.name: Telepathic Dogfighter
abilities.description: While piloting a starship of silhouette 4 or less that is targeted by an attack from an organic opponent, may suffer 4 strain to add {@symbols ffff} to the results.

adversary.name: Jol-Nar Krillostrat Hunter
description: A terrifying masterpiece of weapons engineering, the krillostrat is a heavily armored, gyroscopically stabilized suit-pod large enough to hold a single Hylar atop a mass of razor-sharp tentacles. Armored enough to ignore most small-arms fire, the krillostrat allows its wearer to scamper, climb, and even roll across battlefields, through tunnels, and up building exteriors, using free tentacles to impale or toss enemy troops. The elite hunters who wear these suits take far more pleasure from their kills than most Hylar feel is appropriate.

abilities.name: Grab and Toss
abilities.description: After making a failed combat check, may spend {@symbols aaa} or {@symbols t} to choose one silhouette 1 or 0 character within short range and move them up to one range band in any direction; the character is knocked {@rule prone||crb} and suffers 4 strain.

abilities.name: Multitentacled
abilities.description: After making a successful combat check, may spend 3 strain to inflict one additional hit with tentacle spike against one other target within short range that is no more difficult to hit than the original target, dealing base damage +1 per {@symbols s}; may do so up to three times per turn.

adversary.name: Xxcha Peacemaker
description: The strongest {@archetype Xxcha} soldiers use thick bulwark armor suits to make themselves nearly impervious to incoming fire, and they carry powerful suppression weapons such as assault cannons and siege hammers. Their role is to break the foe and force a surrender, leading to the ironic title of "peacemaker."
gear: {@gear Bulwark plate}: +1 defense, +4 soak, may only perform 1 maneuver per turn

adversary.name: Letnev Naval Commodore
description: The {@rule Barony of Letnev|Barony's} command staff includes some of the finest tactical and strategic thinkers among the Letnev. All are astute students of military history and recognize patterns and opportunities in battle lesser military minds would miss. A commodore in the {@rule Barony of Letnev|Barony's} navy not only captains a major warship, but also oversees entire flotillas of smaller vessels.

abilities.name: Supporting Tactics
abilities.description: As an action, may choose a single allied warship within strategic range and make a {@difficulty Hard|Leadership}; if successful, all opponents may not target other ships with combat checks if they could target the selected allied warship instead.

adversary.name: Sol Spec Ops Drop Trooper
gear: Spec Ops drop armor: 1 defense, +2 soak, add {@dice boost} to {@skill Stealth||crb} checks

adversary.name: Tekklar Elite

abilities.name: Fighting Horde
abilities.description: On combat checks against an opponent engaged with an ally, remove {@dice setback|2} from the pool.

description: A vanguard unit among the already renowned {@rule Sardakk N'orr} legions, Primus G'hom Sek'kus's Tekklar Elite are among the most feared and respected military units in the galaxy. These fearless troops overwhelm their enemies with a combination of brute force, resilience, and the terror that they inspire in their foes.

adversary.name: Winnaran Custodian Guard
description: The Winnaran Custodian Guard have the unenviable task of protecting Mecatol Rex against those who would take it without being declared the rightful inheritors of the Lazax Empire. Since they don't have the military might to see off a determined invader, they actually function as equal parts police officer and paramilitary agent, protecting Mecatol City and the Gul system against criminals, pirates, slavers, and other marauders. The Custodian Guard also work alongside the Keleres, with the two groups each sharing the other's frustrations with scant resources and impossible expectations from their superiors.

adversary.name: Nekro Attack Drone
description: Also referred to as {@i flyers}, these small drones use a triple antigrav thruster design to achieve flight, and their thin legs dangle from a central, sensor-laden body, making them look like some kind of floating spider. Their legs each mount a dart shooter, and they rotate fire to sustain streams of molten darts laced in arsenic. The {@rule Nekro Virus} dispatches them in swarms to disrupt and harass foes, pinning the enemy in place while the massive {@adversary Defiler|Defilers} and {@vehicle Nekro Mordred|Mordreds} close for the slaughter.

adversary.name: Nekro Defiler
description: The Defiler resembles a scorpion of the Sol system but is roughly the size of a tank. It crawls along the ground on six legs, firing the plasma cannon mounted on its tail at infantry formations and light vehicles while using its two pincers to bisect any soldiers that get too close. When faced with armored vehicles, the Defiler can crawl atop them, using its pincers to create an opening in the hull to fire its tail cannon through and burn the crew alive.

abilities.name: Can Opener
abilities.description: May select an engaged vehicle and make a {@difficulty Hard|Athletics}; if successful, a silhouette 0 hole is opened in the vehicle's hull and it suffers a Hull Damaged Critical Hit.

adversary.name: Nekro Grindellow
description: Added to the Nekro arsenal after an attack on a Jol-Nar military outpost, Grindellow Impalers incorporate several design elements from the Hylar krillostrat armored suit. Their large, spherical body supports seven long tentacles, six tipped with leafshaped razor blades and one armed with a long-range positron emitter. Impalers serve the Nekro as advanced infiltration and elimination engines. They often lie dormant, waiting for targets to wander into range before suddenly activating and attacking.

abilities.name: Multitentacled
abilities.description: After making a successful combat check, may spend 3 strain to inflict one additional hit with tentacle blade against one other target within short range that is no more difficult to hit than the original target, dealing base damage +1 per 󲊳; may do so up to three times per turn.

adversary.name: Nekro Pilot AI

abilities.name: Bodiless
abilities.description: Does not need to breathe, eat, or drink and cannot survive outside of a Nekro vehicle; immune to poisons and toxins; cannot suffer damage from attacks but is destroyed if strain causes it to exceed its wound threshold.

description: Nekro piloting AIs are self-aware computer programs enabled to fly or drive any Nekro vehicle. Their greatest advantage is their bodiless form, allowing their vehicles to forgo any sort of life support or cockpit, and ensuring that they can't be killed by a lucky hit or disabled by excessive g-forces.

adversary.name: Nekro Valefar Assimilation Swarm

abilities.name: Viral Infection
abilities.description: may spend {@symbols hhh} or {@symbols d} from an engaged opponent's check to disable one piece of electronic equipment that opponent is carrying; treat as having suffered major damage [see page 89 of the Genesys Core Rulebook].

description: Easily the most insidious {@rule Nekro Virus|Nekro} weapon, the Valefar assimilation swarms are often mistaken for insects, but each of these tiny drones carries the Nekro virus. The swarms can infect and disable what they come in contact with, or simply tear it apart with their positron microemitters, and they often serve as a vanguard for a {@rule Nekro Virus|Nekro} assault.

adversary.name: L1Z1X Enhancer Prodigy
description: Obsessed with their own cybernetic immortality and improving their physical and intellectual capabilities, the L1Z1X enhancers constantly experiment with new cybernetic modifications and implants. While they happily experiment on themselves with new shielding and optics, they prefer the dead and dying for their more…complex tests.

abilities.name: Four-Armed
abilities.description: May perform a second maneuver without suffering strain.

abilities.name: Reboot Resurrection
abilities.description: May make a {@difficulty Hard|Medicine} as an action; if successful, one L1Z1X rival or nemesis within medium range heals 5 wounds plus 1 additional wound per {@symbols s}, or may add one L1Z1X minion to a minion group that has lost at least one minion during the current encounter.

adversary.name: L1Z1X Herald
description: The heralds are the public face, wizened and horrifying though it may be, of the recently emerged L1Z1X. Ostensibly they arrive as ambassadors, but in secret they work behind the scenes to soften a world for L1Z1X invasion if need be. They plant seeds of chaos and discord, and they sabotage planetary defenses with dormant viral agents. They also occasionally engage in real diplomatic negotiations.

abilities.name: Discrete Saboteur
abilities.description: May spend {@symbols t} from a check this character makes to cause one piece of equipment or a vehicle to break and become unusable for the remainder of the encounter.

abilities.name: Four-Armed
abilities.description: May perform a second maneuver without suffering strain.

abilities.name: Upsetting Visage
abilities.description: This character adds {@dice setback|2} to all {@skill Charm||crb} and {@skill Leadership||crb} checks it makes and adds {@dice boost|2} to all {@skill Coercion||crb} checks it makes; if the check inflicts strain, the target suffers 2 additional strain.

adversary.name: L1Z1X Legionnaire
description: When Ibna Vel Syd fled Mecatol Rex just before the fall of the Lazax Empire, he brought with him some loyal Lazax warriors who became the cybernetic template for the L1Z1X Legionnaires. These skeletal, four-armed warriors maintain the skill at arms of the ancient Lazax warriors combined with unnatural durability.

abilities.name: Four-Armed
abilities.description: May perform a second maneuver without suffering strain.

abilities.name: Mindnet
abilities.description: A group of these characters may remain a single minion group while at up to long range of one another.

abilities.name: Nigh-Immortal
abilities.description: After making a check, may spend {@symbols t} to heal all wounds on one defeated minion from this group (returning it to the group with all wounds healed).

adversary.name: L1Z1X Integrated Systems Controller
description: Integrated systems controllers have the ability to plug themselves into a starship and integrate themselves with the ship's computer systems, taking control of smaller vessels or linking with other systems controllers through the Mindnet to coordinate their actions on larger warships. They serve as crew aboard L1Z1X vessels, where they are equally able to operate guns, fly ships, and repair damage.

abilities.name: Four-Armed
abilities.description: May perform a second maneuver without suffering strain.

abilities.name: Mindnet
abilities.description: A group of these characters may remain a single minion group while within long range of one another.

adversary.name: L1Z1X Eliminator
description: Eliminators are L1Z1X special forces units capable of holding position outside enemy fortifications. They sometimes remain in place for years awaiting a L1Z1X invasion fleet so they can call in orbital bombardments or eliminate targets with surgical strikes. They are among the best armed and trained warriors among the L1Z1X.

abilities.name: Designate Target
abilities.description: As an action, may make a {@difficulty Hard|Computers} targeting one structure or location within extreme range; if successful, decrease the difficulty of allied starships' attacks against that target by 2, to a minimum of {@difficulty Easy}, until the end of the round.

weapons.name: Eliminator hight-intensity beam rifle
weapons.details: Decrease difficulty of all checks made at long and extreme range by 1.

adversary.name: Vuil'raith Cultist
description: The galaxy's disaffected and vulnerable congregate secretly in the ebon cracks of great cities and isolated outposts to worship the Vuil'raith. Corrupted by false promises, the cultists unwittingly pave the road to their own eventual destruction. Of course, some of the worst cultists are those who know exactly what their actions will bring about and commit to them all the more eagerly.
gear: Hooded cloak: 1 defense, add {@dice boost} to {@skill Stealth||crb} checks

adversary.name: Vuil'raith Cult Leader
description: The Vuil'raith often strike bargains with forgotten, angry, or disaffected members of society to foment chaos and involve them in the Vuil'raith's twisted machinations. In exchange for power and knowledge, these damaged individuals find other vulnerable people and indoctrinate them to work evil on behalf of their malign patron. Each cult has slightly different trappings and traditions, but all work toward the goals of the Vuil'raith.

abilities.name: Vuil'raith Bargain
abilities.description: Once per encounter, may spend a Story Point as an out-of-turn incidental to heal up to 6 wounds that this character is suffering.

gear: Hooded cloak: 1 defense, add {@dice boost} to {@skill Stealth||crb} checks

adversary.name: Vuil'raith Cabalist
description: The cabalists are the most powerful of the abominations that live in the flesh-horror dimension of the Vuil'raith. They lead hordes of the lesser Vuil'raith or scheme to become one of the Vuil'raith Cabal. They possess a kind of insight that enables them to see what fears and desires drive their enemies and to manipulate them into becoming allies. Each cabalist has their own motives and drives as well, making them as likely to war with one another as with the rest of the galaxy.

abilities.name: Tempting Lies
abilities.description: As an action, may make an {@b opposed {@skill Deception||crb} versus {@skill Vigilance||crb} check} targeting one opponent within medium range; if successful, target is {@rule immobilized||crb} until they make a successful {@difficulty Daunting|Cool} as an action; may spend {@symbols t} from check to cause target to also suffer 8 strain.

abilities.name: Terrifying
abilities.description: At the start of the encounter, all opponents must make a {@difficulty Daunting|fear|2} as an out-of-turn incidental, as per page 243 of the {@title Genesys} Core Rulebook; if there are multiple sources of fear in the encounter, opponents only make one fear check against the most terrifying enemy.

adversary.name: Vuil'raith Devourer Swarm
description: These small, flying creatures take a variety of forms, resembling bats, birds, or even insect swarms from a distance. However, up close they can envelop a target, tearing flesh from its body until there is nothing left but bones in moments. The always-ravenous devourers also act as spies and forward scouts, relaying enemy locations back to their masters instantaneously through some unexplained link to their alien home dimension.

abilities.name: Devour
abilities.description: When attacking an {@rule immobilized||crb} or {@rule prone||crb} target, each uncanceled {@symbols s} increases the damage dealt by +2 instead of +1.

adversary.name: Vuil'raith Looming Abomination
description: Each of these imposing beings has a uniquely fearsome appearance, dominated by a head featuring jagged jaws and extra eyes, atop a powerful form covered in a tough, scaly hide and an unsettling number of arms, tentacles, and other appendages. They flip over mechs and crush armored soldiers with equal ease, sending whoever isn't frozen by fear fleeing in blind panic.

abilities.name: Vehicle Flip
abilities.description: As an action, may make a {@difficulty Daunting|Athletics} to target a vehicle of up to silhouette 3; if successful, the vehicle is overturned, cannot move, and suffers a Critical Hit; other effects, such as being unable to fire weapons, may occur at the GM's discretion.

adversary.name: Vuil'raith Nightmare Horde
description: The Vuil'raith shape flesh to strike terror in their victims. The rank and file of their nightmare armies are gibbering meatshapes of fanged maws, razor-sharp claws, flailing tentacles, and countless glowing eyes, all intended to leave their foes recoiling in horror.

abilities.name: Horde of Nightmares
abilities.description: If an opponent in the encounter makes a fear check because of an ally of the Nightmare Horde, add {@dice setback} to the check for each Nightmare Horde minion group present in the encounter.

adversary.name: Vuil'raith Terror Beast
description: Terror beasts are incredibly long, millipede-like creatures that can carry dozens of Vuil'raith invaders on their backs. Their many legs end in sharp points, perfect for skewering enemy troops while they run to deposit their horde where it can sow the most fear.

abilities.name: A Hundred Scything Legs
abilities.description: Whenever the terror beast makes a check (including a combat check), may spend {@symbols a} or {@symbols t} to cause one engaged enemy to suffer a hit from this character's skewer-legs, dealing base damage.

abilities.name: Terrifying
abilities.description: At the start of the encounter, all opponents must make a {@difficulty Formidable|fear} as an out-of-turn incidental, as per page 243 of the {@title Genesys} Core Rulebook; if there are multiple sources of fear in the encounter, opponents only make one fear check against the most terrifying enemy.

adversary.name: Mahact Crimson Legionnaire
description: Enthralled Creuss warriors, these hulking sentinels wear runecovered armor that glows an ominous crimson instead of the cold blue of most Creuss armor. Each of the Crimson Legionnaires was once a part of the grand armada dispatched to search for Ixth. When they discovered the Mahact tomb, the genesorcerers corrupted them all, many hundreds of thousands of individuals bound to serve in an instant. Now the Mahact use them as an elite praetorian guard, the core of an army that the gene-sorcerers are building to reconquer the galaxy.

abilities.name: Legion Fighter
abilities.description: While engaged with an opponent, may spend a maneuver to add {@symbols ss} to the results of the next melee combat check an ally makes targeting that opponent before the start of this character's next turn.

abilities.name: Wormhole Walker
abilities.description: May spend a Story Point to teleport anywhere within extreme range as a maneuver.

gear: Crimson runic armor: 2 defense, +2 soak, +6 would threshold

adversary.name: Mahact Thrall Clone
description: These white, smooth-skinned humanoids have blank slates as faces, with no visible ears, eyes, nose, or mouth. Their muscular arms have long, thin fingers tipped with sharp claw-nails, but their most dangerous weapon is a thin spike that protrudes from their wrist. If the spike manages to sink into the unprotected flesh of a biological creature, the thrall clone can inject a genetic virus that quickly and fundamentally begins to alter the target's DNA. Within minutes, the victim's body starts to mutate, continuing until they have become yet another thrall clone.

Most of the Mahact's thrall clones, however, are grown from amniotic tanks on {@rule Ixth}. The {@rule Mahact Gene-Sorcerers|Mahact} produce billions of them to serve as expendable shock troops or as an equally expendable labor force.

abilities.name: Blank
abilities.description: May not be targeted by or suffer strain form social skill checks.

abilities.name: Genetic Payload
abilities.description: Once per encounter as an action, may make an {@b opposed {@skill Brawl||crb} versus {@skill Coordination||crb} check} targeting one engaged nonmechanical opponent; if successful, the target must make a {@difficulty Hard|Resilience} at the end of the current encounter; if they fail, they suffer 2 wounds and must make the check again every five minutes until they succeed or they exceed their wound threshold, at which point the target becomes a Mahact thrall clone [if they are a PC, they are effectively dead at this point]; this effect may also be ended with a successful {@difficulty Daunting|Medicine}.

adversary.name: Mahact Cloned Pilot Brain Network
description: This adversary is mentioned in the {@vehicle Interceptor Starfighter (Mahact Dominus Strike Drone)|Mahact Dominus Strike Drone} vehicle, but was not published with a statblock of its own.

abilities.name: Electromagnetic Feet
abilities.description: Can move normally in zero-gravity.

abilities.name: Nekro
abilities.description: Does not need to breathe, eat, or drink and can survive in vacuum; immune to poisons and toxins.

abilities.name: Nekro
abilities.description: Does not need to breathe, eat, or drink and can survive in vacuum; immune to poisons and toxins.

abilities.name: Applied Education
abilities.description: Once per encounter, may add {@symbols aa} to any skill check.

archetype.name: Creuss

description: A Creuss starts with one rank in {@skill Vigilance||crb}. They obtain this rank before spending experience points, and they may not increase {@skill Vigilance||crb} above rank 2 during character creation

abilities.name: Incorporeal
description: Your character lacks corporeal presence. When wearing sealed armor or an environmental suit, your character acts as normal. However, when not wearing armor, when your character makes {@characteristic Brawn||crb}- or {@characteristic Agility||crb}-based checks, increase the difficulty by 2. When a corporeal character makes a {@characteristic Brawn||crb}- or {@characteristic Agility||crb}-based check targeting your character, increase the difficulty by 2. Your character increases their soak by their {@characteristic Willpower||crb} (in addition to their {@characteristic Brawn||crb}). Your character can move through most mundane types of difficult and impassable terrain without penalty but cannot stop inside solid surfaces. Outside of the Shaleri anomaly or their home dimension, your character suffers 1 strain at the end of each of their turns. If this causes them to exceed their strain threshold, they suffer one Critical Injury at the end of each of their turns as well, until they are able to return to a habitable environment. In addition, your character does not need to eat, breathe, or sleep and is immune to poisons and toxins.

abilities.name: Insubstantial Form
description: Creuss do not gain the benefits of healing wounds with {@gear dermal sealer|dermal sealers} ({@rule painkillers||crb}) or {@skill Medicine||crb} checks. Creuss do heal wounds and strain naturally by resting. In addition, when they make a check to heal strain at the end of an encounter, they may spend {@symbols a} to heal 1 wound (and may spend multiple {@symbols a} to do so), and they may spend {@symbols a} equal to a Critical Injury's severity (or {@symbols t}) to heal a Critical Injury.

abilities.name: Ethereal Awareness
description: Once per session as an out-of-turn incidental, you may spend a Story Point to have your character become aware of everything that is currently within long range of your character (this includes concealed enemies, hidden passageways, and what is behind sealed doors).
Your character starts the game with a {@gear sealed environmental suit} (see page 117).

The Creuss have the dubious distinction of being a species not of the material universe. They come from a region of twisted and torn space known as the Shaleri anomaly. Here the physical laws of the universe begin to break down. The heart of the anomaly is a wormhole known as the Creuss Gate, which leads to a universe completely unlike our own, where exotic energies replace molecular bonds and coalesce into beings of light and radiation.

These beings call themselves the Creuss. In their natural state, they are nothing more than a wispy glow of fluctuating blue energy, formless and insubstantial. Such beings have great difficulty interacting with the material universe, so in the shattered space where the two universes meet, the Creuss have established foundries and stations where they can manipulate solid matter. They create armor that can contain their ethereal forms and give them a physical presence, and ships and equipment to further their interactions in the material universe.
why: The Creuss function very differently from most species. Outside of their armor, they are insubstantial ghosts who unfortunately can quickly wither away and even die when exposed to "normal" reality. But if they're bold enough, they can leave their suit for short periods of time and take advantage of their ethereal form.

A Creuss character probably serves the interests of the {@rule Ghosts of Creuss}, the mysterious faction of Creuss that has taken an interest in the material universe and potentially in ruling the shattered Imperium. However, not all Creuss remain loyal to their home dimension and work to support its power in the material universe. Some have ventured into the wider galaxy simply to explore and experience this strange realm. If you like the idea of playing a mysterious traveler who can teleport from place to place, an enigmatic sage who speaks in riddles, or a smug researcher with a unique perspective on the world, a Creuss is the right choice for you

description: The Creuss have two names, the first being an identifier of social status and rank, and the second a personal name. The first is usually a three-letter word starting with S, while the last name tends to be three to four syllables long, with soothing, drawn-out vowels and consonants that give it a flowing sound.
Some examples include:

archetype.name: Druaa

description: A Druaa starts with one rank in {@skill Discipline||crb}. They obtain this rank before spending experience points, and they may not increase {@skill Discipline||crb} above rank 2 during character creation.

abilities.name: Mind Reader
description: As an action, your character may make an {@b opposed {@skill Discipline||crb} versus {@skill Discipline||crb} check} targeting one living creature within medium range. If successful, your character knows the target's current thoughts and emotional state. {@symbols aaa} or {@symbols t} may be spent to discover other thoughts or memories, at your GM's discretion.

The serpentine Druaa would be simply one more species in a galaxy full of sentient life if it weren't for their singular gift: they appear to be the only species in the galaxy with a highly advanced form of telepathy. Scientists are unsure how this ability works, and the Druaa are notably loath to allow other species to investigate it. But they have spent centuries refining their technology to enhance their innate abilities, so it is likely they possess a deep understanding that they'll never share with others.

Beyond their abilities to read minds and alter thoughts, the Druaa are a cold-blooded reptilian species with a humanoid torso that shifts into a massive serpentine body. A Druaa's face is humanoid as well, although their skin is covered in scales, and they sport a fanlike skin-crest that stretches out from their skull. Everything about this species seems to be equal parts graceful and unsettling.

Although many people think of them as the {@rule Naalu Collective|Naalu}, the serpentine species hailing from {@rule Druaa and Maaluuk|Druaa} insists that their species shares the same name as their home. In fact, they claim {@rule Druaa and Maaluuk|Druaa} was named after their species during their early eras of scientific enlightenment. However, those scholars who believe the Druaa actually evolved on neighboring {@rule Druaa and Maaluuk|Maaluuk} suggest that they chose the name of their adopted homeworld to help cement their claim.
why: The Druaa start with slightly fewer experience points and a lower wound and strain threshold than other species, but they trade this for the unique ability to read minds. This makes them very powerful in social settings and can also be used in all sorts of creative ways by inventive players

description: Druaa names are constructed of harsh "t" and "k" consonants paired with soft syllables, and they are pronounced with a notable hiss. These names are always written with a single consonant first, then an apostrophe, then the remainder of the name. This pattern holds whether the Druaa has two names or one (both are common, depending on the Druaa subculture). Since the entire species is telepathic, they rely on mental projections instead of names to communicate concepts such as rank, status, and family. Thus, names are purely a means of personal identity.
Some examples include:

archetype.name: Gashlai

description: A Gashlai starts with two ranks in {@skill Mechanics||crb}. They obtain this rank before spending experience points, and they may not increase {@skill Mechanics||crb} above rank 3 during character creation.

abilities.name: Integral Combustion
description: When a non-Gashlai is engaged with a Gashlai, they are exposed to a fire with a rating of 5 (see page 111 of the Core Rulebook). Gashlai do not suffer damage from weapons with the {@quality Burn||crb} item quality (whether or not the quality is activated). When a Gashlai who is not wearing a sealed environmental suit is present in any environment that does not have temperatures between 400 and 2,000 degrees Celsius, they suffer 1 strain at the end of each of their turns. If this causes them to exceed their strain threshold, they suffer one Critical Injury at the end of each of their turns as well, until they are able to return to a habitable environment.

abilities.name: Ember Suit
description: Your character starts the game with a {@gear sealed environmental suit} (see page 117). While your character is wearing the suit, engaged non-Gashlai are not exposed to a fire with a rating of 5.

abilities.name: Focused Heat
description: While your character is wielding a {@filter gear|Melee or Brawl weapon|source:embers-of-the-imperium=1;type:weapon=1;skill:brawl=1,melee=1} (including their unarmed attacks), that weapon gains the {@quality Burn|Burn 2|crb} item quality if it did not already have the {@quality Burn||crb} item quality. When making a combat check with a {@filter gear|Melee or Brawl weapon|source:embers-of-the-imperium=1;type:weapon=1;skill:brawl=1,melee=1}, your character may suffer 3 strain to trigger the {@quality Burn||crb} quality without spending {@symbols a}.

Even in a galaxy of oddities and mysteries, the Gashlai are unique. Each is a raging inferno, an organism constantly enveloped in a roiling blanket of flame and heat. Unlike most living beings, the Gashlai conceive their children by creating an embryo in a "cocoon" that somehow draws energy from its surroundings and converts it into mass. When a Gashlai is birthed from their cocoon, their squat, bulky body erupts into flame as that mass begins to return to energy. This process continues for the rest of their very long life, until the last of their body is consumed, the flames gutter out, and the Gashlai dies.

The Gashlai could only evolve on a volcanic world like {@rule Muaat}, where most of the lowlands are hotter than blast furnaces, since prolonged exposure to temperatures others might consider normal causes them to radiate heat much faster and even "burn out" and expire. But even {@rule Muaat} has its colder climates, mountainous highlands where the temperatures are a "frigid" thirty-two to fifty-five degrees Celsius. To explore these alien realms, the Gashlai developed cumbersome personal transports that could preserve their internal heat: the precursors to their famous Ember suits.
why: Gashlai tend to be strong and tough with high wound and strain thresholds. They make good mechanics and solid combatants, and can take on hybrid roles as combat engineers. They also have the unique ability to set people around them on fire (although they risk injuring themselves in the process).
